result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Treon D. Mitchell

records.addlTxt:
9:15 AM Defendant Treon D. Mitchell in court.  Attorney Terry William Rose in court for Treon D. Mitchell.  Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.  DE has not completed his treatment program.  Matter will resolve upon completion. Adjmt granted.  Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 1, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Supervision Status Report.  In order to satisfy all the program requirements, the defendant must complete primary treatment and pay the remaining balance on the client service fee.

Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Rose. Clerk/S. Garcia. Judge Meier presiding for Judge Dougvillo.  ADA Star requests an adjournment to speak with colleagues in Racine.  Final pre-trial set for 9:00.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
WCS Supervision Status Report.  In order to satisfy all the program requirements, the defendant must complete primary treatment and pay the remaining balance on the client service fee.
